title: Why is remake at 3 minutes?
body:
Who thought of the three minute threshold?

Like, was a number just plucked out of the air?

I just had a game where our Jungler came back at 2:58. Does Riot not know that 2:58 is already a two-level difference between Junglers?

Just have a think about that, Riot. Three minutes makes so fucking sense. Make it by the time minions have spawned.

The person who disconnected has already had like 3 minutes to reconnect while we sit at the loading page. No need to give them another three minutes, and allow them to fuck the game up.

How did three minutes come to pass? I'm fuckin' curious.

replies.body:
better than the old days when there was no remake ever.

a broken system is better than none at all
surrender votes are also terrible ff15 should be 4/5 and everything after 20 should be pure majority rule 3/5

The player must be playing 90 seconds of the first 180 seconds of the game to NOT allow a remake.

That means, that if he connects, plays until 1:31, then goes AFK, you will not get a remake.

Is this fair?  I don't like it, but that's the rule.

It also means that your scenario is not correct.
so why not get it done in 1:30 mins and not make everyone wait when the game is obviously a losing one

Like I said.. .that's what Riot decided.

It makes a little bit of sense, but I can see many things wrong with it.  They should allow to surrender after any champion goes AFK for 5 mins

3 minutes is typically when lane dominance is established so its not too horrible if someone is back within 3 minutes, after that amount of time though there isn't really much of a chance even with defensive playstyle to come back or be useful to your team. For jungler though its tougher but hey thats just one role.
